article.title: Baryon number fluctuations in chiral effective models and their phenomenological implications

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the rapid drop in the kurtosis ratio (κσ²) at T/Tc ≈ 1 signify?
choices: The onset of chiral symmetry restoration.
A change in the degrees of freedom carrying baryon number.
The weakening of repulsive vector interactions.
The formation of a quark-gluon plasma.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding the behavior of the ratio ΧΒ^(3,1) in the (T, μq) plane?
choices: It exhibits a strong dependence on the chemical potential at low temperatures.
It can be used as a measure of temperature.
It diverges at the chiral phase boundary.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the effect of increasing the vector coupling (gw) on the contour lines of the kurtosis ratio (ΧΒ^(4,2))?
choices: Shifts the contours towards lower T and higher μq.
Increases the magnitude of the kurtosis ratio.
Shifts the contours towards higher T and lower μq.
Has negligible effect on the contour lines.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the PQM model, what happens to the skewness ratio (ΧΒ^(3,2)) as the CEP is approached along the chiral phase boundary?
